description:
Burkholderia contaminans is a species of Gram-negative, aerobic, non-spore-forming, motile bacteria belonging to the Burkholderia genus. It is commonly found in environmental sources such as soil, water, and plant rhizospheres.

Burkholderia contaminans is known for its versatile metabolic capabilities and ability to adapt to various ecological niches. It can thrive in nutrient-rich and nutrient-poor environments, and has been reported to possess plant growth-promoting properties, as well as the ability to degrade a wide range of organic compounds, including xenobiotics.

This species has gained attention due to its potential role in certain clinical settings, where it has been associated with opportunistic infections, particularly in immunocompromised individuals. Additionally, some strains of B. contaminans have been identified as potential contaminants in clinical and laboratory environments, highlighting the importance of proper biosafety and quality control measures.

Overall, Burkholderia contaminans is a versatile and adaptable bacterium that continues to be the subject of ongoing research in various fields, from environmental microbiology to clinical microbiology and biotechnology.
